verses.verse: Whom hast thou helped? Him that is wtout strength? what comforte geuest thou vnto hym that hath no strength?
Where is the councell that thou shuldest geue him, which hath no wysdome? Hast thou shewed the waye of ryght lyuinge.
To whom hast thou spoken those wordes? Who made the breth to come out of thy mouth?
Are not deed thinges shapen vnder the waters: & thinges by the waters syde?
Hell is naked before him, and the very destruccion it selfe cannot be hyd out of his syght.
He stretcheth out the north ouer the emptie, and hangeth the earth vpon nothing.
He byndeth the waters in his cloudes, and the cloude is not broken vnder them.
He holdeth back his stole, that it cannot be sene, and spredeth his cloude before it.
He hath compased the waters with certayne boundes vntill the daye & nyght come to an ende.
The very pyllers of heauen tremble and quake at his reprofe.
He stilleth the se with his power, and thorow his wysdome smyteth he the strength therof.
Hys sprete hath garnisshed the heauens, and hys hande hath made the rebellious serpent.
Lo, this is nowe a shorte summe of his wayes. But who is able sufficiently to rehearse hys workes? Who can perceaue and vnderstande the thondre of hys power?
